text: "The Raven" is a narrative poem by American writer Edgar Allan Poe, first published on January 29, 1845. It tells the story of a mysterious talking raven who visits a lover; it shows how the lover is slowly going insane. It is often called Poe's most famous poem, its publication made him famous in his day, and today it is still one of the most recognized and respected poems in American literature. == Other websites == *https://blog.prepscholar.com/the- raven-poem-summary Category:19th-century American poems Category:Poems by Edgar Allan Poe Category:1840s poems
title: The Raven
